channel.title: Turks on Vishvas's notes
channel.description: Recent content in Turks on Vishvas's notes

item.title: Uyghur
item.description: Tocharians and shaka-s â†’ uighur (with significant genetic input) The Uighur Turks, who absorbed the earlier Indo-European Tocharian civilization, showed how a genuine steppe potentate, which mixes militarism directed against sedentary populations and trade with them, could emerge. Notably, they laid the foundations for many aspects of the government of a steppe empire, which the later Mongols would adopt. These included the first script of the Chingizid Mongols.
